website_summaries.verdict: It's easy to be creative using this black wireless graphic tablet, which comes with 2 free art software downloads.
pros: Draw, paint, or color with precision and control using this tablet, which has 4096 levels of pressure sensitivity
Pen is fast (speed 133 pps), doesn't need charging
Slim and portable, with generous drawing space of 6" x 3.7”
4 customizable ExpressKeys to set up your own shortcuts
Includes 2 free downloadable art software upon product registration
cons: Some buyers had difficulty with set-up – installing drivers or compatibility issues
Pen nib appears to wear out quickly, requiring replacement

customer_reviews.title: HUGE disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Took forever to install all the software and the proper drivers. Does NOT work with Windows 10. I mean, you can draw things, but you cannot make pure shades of gray, only tints of pink. So the gift that someone was overjoyed to receive on Christmas morning turns out to be a piece of junk that is now never used and a huge disappointment. Totally USELESS.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wicks

customer_reviews.title: Issue with the website to register tablet and redeem free software
customer_reviews.text: Tablet works great, customer service is great The problem is when I went to register the product for the bundled application that the website to log in kept forcing me out which so far has prevented me from downloading the software. The registration had to go through live chat customer support rather than through what I thought was the normal avenue for registration. If the company reads this, please fix!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Starter Tablet (Great for students)
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Wacom Tablet I've owned, the first one was a Wacom Intous3. My Pro: Extremely Portable Reasonably Size Very Light Durable No Pen Battery Tablets Internal Battery lasts for a few days Depending on which Size, Non-Bluetooth or Bluetooth you get up to three drawing software. My Cons: Only 6 programable key bind (2 including the pen) Depending on which Size, Non-Bluetooth or Bluetooth you get up to three drawing software. Pen is a little too light, prefer it be a little more heavier. It feels like I'm holding an empty mechanical pencil.
customer_reviews.author: ⚜ Aaron ⚜

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, free software!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing if you are a beginning graphic artist! The software you get for free with it is very good and worth like $50. The stylus comes with extra nibs in the bottom but I haven’t needed to change it yet! Love Wacom
customer_reviews.author: Deb V

customer_reviews.title: This requires an online account / log in / tracking etc.  DOES NOT PLUG AND PLAY
customer_reviews.text: This requires an online account / log in / tracking etc. PRODUCT DOES NOT PLUG AND PLAY Throw back to the 1990's with required loading of drivers, had to navigate to a poorly designed web page, required log in and personal info... NO WAY.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: The only reason why I would buy the PRO is the extra buttons
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, I have no idea how I was editing in Lightroom and Photoshop just using a mouse. This might be the "entry level," aka the cheapest, Wacom tablet in the market, but it does the trick. The size is perfect if you plan to use it for just a few hours per day and it is really portable, I love it. The only reason why I would buy the PRO (ASIN B00EN27ULS) instead is the extra function buttons, and they are handy if you want to use the tablet and ditch the keyboard (and keyboard shortcuts). Also, even though is the cheapest one available it is really sensitive and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Can’t really complain at all
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about this product, the pressure sensitivity works great as it should, the shallowness of the buttons work great as a temporary stylus holder, and the driver setup is easy to figure out. The fact that the micro USB port is flush and can fit any micro usb cable is also a great design choice by Wacom. Unboxing experience makes it feel like it has quality. Great product for beginning artists and pro photoshop know how!
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Drivers and supposed free software impossible to find and download, website is crap.
customer_reviews.text: There is one line of instructions about how to download the "free" software - go to their website, download the driver and when you register your product you can get the software. When you go there, the site doesn't load properly, it gives no clue how to register the product, and no matter which link you select, it comes back to the same home page. I have a very disappointed daughter who cannot use her new drawing pad on Christmas day. I'm returning this and going to the local Micro Center where I can actually get some customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Lach

customer_reviews.title: Cannot activate product, stuck on trial version
customer_reviews.text: So I just got the tablet today and I can't be any happier about it. Good size for the price and works pretty smoothly. I got the small bluetooth one, so I was allowed 2 of the 3 products (which convinced me to buy it in the end tbh). Downloaded Clip Studio Paint Pro perfectly fine (it was the main program I wanted anyway), however when I tried to download and run Corel Painter Essentials 6, it asked me for an activation code (NOT the serial number which wacom provides for you). Unless I've missed something, I think this is really annoying to get an "Error: Invalid Serial Number" message when the installer claims otherwise. PLEASE FIX IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you have windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I have windows 10 on the laptop I wanted to use this with but I could not register it. I did 2 live chats with Wacom and both customer service reps told me the product would not work with windows 10 and that I needed to return it. Amazon was great and allowed me to return the product. I was disappointed that no where in the item descriptions did it say would not work with windows 10. I had seen bad reviews around Christmas time but I'd hoped it was just because Wacom's system was overloaded. That was not the case... be forewarned and don't buy this product if you run windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Jodena Beard

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is really great for the beginner who want to learn how to do digital drawing. I let my friends ten years old kid use it and she loves it immediately and after ten minutes she is already get used to it. I use 21" and 13" cintiq for my design work; however, I want something i can take out to coffee shop and work there. this built-in Bluetooth is so perfect for my situation. Although there's still some small issues like nib disappear so fast and the pen pressure is a bit weird for me. it's still a great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: evolutionvii7

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work with macOS Mojave!!
customer_reviews.text: It not compatible with macOS Mojave!!, I calles custumer services of wacom and the y coudn’t give me an answer, they had a very poor custumer service they told me that they are working on that problem, but... it have Been 2months since i Bought it and i stick can’t work in it, because it doesn’t read the pencil, ugh, I not happy with that...
customer_reviews.author: MPia

customer_reviews.title: Easy for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I’m completely new with drawing tablets but I was able to adapt drawing with it right away. It does take awhile to set up but once you do it’s worth it. If you’re new to tablets and don’t know which one to get I definitely recommend this one. It’s small and affordable especially with the drawing programs it comes with it’s a great way to start. And drawing becomes easier the more you use it.
customer_reviews.author: isabel

customer_reviews.title: A great beginners tablet
customer_reviews.text: Great starting tablet for beginner digital artists or graphic designers! I use it for traveling since it's small and it fits well inside my laptop bag. The only thing I have a problem with is that the bottom doesn't act like an eraser when I flip it around, but I probably didn't read the description details to figure that one out. Nonetheless, I really enjoy this product!
customer_reviews.author: PuddinSkins

customer_reviews.title: It works great and it was as easy as plug-n-play on my ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great and it was as easy as plug-n-play on my Linux laptop (running Peppermint OS 8) I didn't have to install any drivers, it worked immediately after plugging it in. It works as a mouse replacement, and I also tested it in Pinta, Gimp, and OpenBoard (I mostly bought it for use in OpenBoard). The tablet itself is very responsive and smooth. The buttons on the pen and on the tablet work. The pressure sensitivity works when affecting the brush stroke OpenBoard, but didn't affect the brush stroke in Pinta or Gimp. I guess that's just because Pinta and Gimp don't recognize different pressures, but I'm not sure. It's working great and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Harding

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 days + horrible nib
customer_reviews.text: So this is a modified review. The nib was wearing down pretty fast like other reviewers said, and I thought it was going to be okay until literally the brand new nib stopped working after 2 days. It wasn't even that worn down. My pen would be uncontrollable unless I put in a new nib, which is completely baffling. How can anyone use this if they are expected to replace the nib every 2 days? Additionally, the right click button (default top button of pen) also stopped working. Bluetooth is a joke - delays and unregistered clicks. Steer clear of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Ju

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get used to
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for my work computer. Since work doesn't give me a device that I can use a pen on the screen, I needed this. Geez, after being used to drawing right on the screen, it is so incredibly hard to draw looking at the screen while your hand is drawing in a different location than where your eyes look at. I mean if you are used to it, this device is fine. But if you have a chance to get something like a Microsoft Surface with pen, do it. It's sooo much easier.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: not practical at all
customer_reviews.text: i got this for editing pictures and drawing on photoshop. i REALLY had high hopes when i first got however after setting it up it was really difficult to work with. for example, the picture on photoshop covers only 40% of the whole screen then this means you will use only 40% of this tiny device. to be more specific if you want to draw something it you will be using an extremely small area of the tablet which is impossible to do.
customer_reviews.author: BinTamim

customer_reviews.title: What kind of tech company's web site crashes?
customer_reviews.text: So far this thing is a dud because the Wacom web site crashes every time we try to register the product to get the accompanying software. Makes you wonder...if the web site is the key to using the product, and the web site doesn't work, how good could this product really be. Getting ready to send it back if we can't talk to an actual human being soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Fabriani

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend loved
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my boyfriend after his bamboo splash broke, he says he loves it more than the last one! The main thing he says he enjoys is that the pad is sized to fit the screen, so now when he reaches the bottom of the pad with his pen it’s reaching the bottom of the computer frame as well so he doesn’t need to lift up and continue with a second stroke. Is also came in two days even though I’d chosen free 5-8 day shipping
customer_reviews.author: Sophiec

customer_reviews.title: Great for Remote Teaching
customer_reviews.text: When Covid-19 forced me to teach my students remotely, I purchased this so I could write on it while making instructional videos or while teaching via Zoom. It was truly a lifesaver for me, as it made my job easier. Rather than using the document camera I was sent home with and having to manually switch my computer screen back and forth, this little drawing tablet allowed me to transition smoothly between my webcam, slides, and what I needed to write by hand. I don't know what school will be like in the fall, but in any case, I will continue to use this for teaching.
customer_reviews.author: Indie Reader

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tracking
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a 2 year old bamboo tablet that she lost the stylus for; we purchased this as a replacement. The tracking on the tablet makes it completely unusable. The cursor jumps across the screen a quarter inch at a time, causing anything but the largest movements to be completely futile.
customer_reviews.author: WICoach

customer_reviews.title: Is it online?
customer_reviews.text: Product is not shipped with software or drivers. One has to download from the Wacom website. Problem is, their website is down as I write this, and apparently has been unavailable for over two days according to isitdownrightnow.com (lots of frustration voiced in the comments there!). Tracked down a Tweet from Wacom with a link to download the driver and now I'm good to go. You should try to see if you can get to wacom.com before ordering to be on the safe side if you require the software that is supposedly included with this purchase. Otherwise you can find the driver link on their official Twitter feed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huggins

customer_reviews.title: I fixed my bluetooth problem
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing the Wacom Intuos 2018 I read reviews with concerns for the nibs and those with Bluetooth connectivity issues. However, the nibs seem fine, I did buy a screen cover. Initially, the Bluetooth wouldn't work. I found that by pressing the Windows key on a Windows laptop along with "r" on the keyboard a box appears. Type in ncpa.cpl press ok and then the Bluetooth network connection option and then add a device. I also found clip studio to be my favorite program to use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, terrible Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: In short, this is a fantastic little tablet for any beginner, or any artist who wants a really portable way to draw digitally. It works extremely well, except in one way: Bluetooth connectivity. No matter how many different devices I connect this thing to, and no matter where I use it, the amount of lag when drawing in Bluetooth mode makes this thing completely unusable. I resorted to only drawing using the included USB cable for the time that I had it. My recommendation: Save your money and buy the cheaper non-Bluetooth version, or, don't rely on Bluetooth for any precise work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex deMeurers

customer_reviews.title: Why did they remove the touch features...
customer_reviews.text: Wacom, what are you thinking? Are you trying to get people to buy the pro-version? I have the original Wacom tablet and yes it has a cord, and yes if you want to install it on a new computer you have to find a CD drive somewhere but it works so much better than this and it had touch features!!! I do not want to buy the massive pro tablet that is going to take up half of my desk just so I can have touch features bring them back on the smaller tablet please.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Cline Council

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse alternative!
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting a sore wrist while using a computer - even with an ergonomic mouse. I switched to this little wacom table and it's been phenomenal. There's a bit of a learning curve to train yourself that the shape of the tablet is mapped to your computer screen, but it's just as fast as a mouse once you're past the learning curve (give it a few days). It also works great with Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop - drawing with a "pen" is much more natural and intuitive than using a traditional mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Digital_Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Cannot not get it started.
customer_reviews.text: As of right now I would rate this product a 1. Unable to get customer support because they are never there when I am home. This was a Christmas gift for a teen and so far we are unable to complete the set up and get the software. So disappointed. Never had this much trouble with any electronic device. As of right now I would NOT recommend this product to anyone. Cannot tell you if it works great or not due to can't even get it to work
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Smith

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN PRODUCT. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Product died within 3 months. Horrible quality. Had to keep updating. Didnt work well at all.
customer_reviews.author: korra

customer_reviews.title: Fun Drawing Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. It takes some getting used to, but after you can get used to it, it's super accurate down to pressure and positioning. It's super fun to draw with this. However, the free software that comes with it is not that awesome. I gave it 4 stars because I don't really think it's worth the whole 80 dollars to include the software. But I still bought it and I don't regret the quality of the tablet itself
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but registering for a the freebee software is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but registering for a the freebee software is a pain in the butt. Have difficulties which their auto install doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Joel V

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on a used one, it works really well. The software can only be accessed via download - there are no disks. You'll have to register your product and keep your license keys. This is the only nightmarish process because you have to keep registering for all these separate softwares. The pad itself is responsive and easy enough to control. As a newbie to drawing on computer, it took some time to learn but overall with some practice you'll learn to use it well. YouTube tutorials are highly recommended if you're a newbie like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Bionic Man

customer_reviews.title: Very easy set up for Mac
customer_reviews.text: I own the Pro version and found that it takes up too much space on my desktop so decided try this smaller version to see how it compares. So far, it's been a hit. Super easy set up, just plug it in, Welcome screen comes up walks you through how to use the tablet and then updates to the latest software. I find that it's just as sensitive as the pro version, much better than the Bamboo tablet that I used to own before the Pro. I don't do a lot of heavy graphics so I'm sure the pro would excel, but for general photoshop use, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Very natural and easy to start using
customer_reviews.text: I had a Wacom Bamboo for years that I rarely used. I broke the Bamboo pen recently, so bought this to replace it. This is so much nicer. It feels more natural. Unfortunately, I cannot compare side-by-side, but I remember struggling more with the Bamboo. This is very easy to pick up and use. I was debating between this Small and the Medium, but read in other reviews that people prefer the Small since it then requires less hand motion. You can easily zoom in to work in greater detail when needed. No regrets on this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: T. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: The Bluetooth doesn't work too well
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth really isnt that great and i have to keep it connected to my computer 24 seven. The buttons on the pen don't work correctly either. It felt pointless to upgrade to this when my old tablet worked better, with wireless and the pen
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Site errors prevented registration and software downloads
customer_reviews.text: I would love to rate the product, but due to site issues i can only rate a failed set-up over a 3 hour time span due to wacom site errors. Slow performance, constant timeouts, 500 and 502 errors prevented registration and installation of software. I was able to finally get an account setup after the 3 hours of constant retries. Very disappointed for our daughter who was very excited about her Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tablet works but impossible to register and download software
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely disappointed by the included directions and company website. The product comes with 3 free drawing programs with can be downloaded from the website. Unfortunately, the web link doesn't work. The site will not load. I tried to register the device directly at the website and it wouldn't work. I tried to register the device from the desktop app and it wouldn't work. The included directions show drawings of how to connect the tablet to the computer and a link to register. That's it. I feel like the company is falsely advertising their product when it's impossible to access the software. It certainly seems like a scam. I regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rickard

customer_reviews.title: Don't really like it
customer_reviews.text: It's rather small, and I dislike the feature that the cursor will move on screen to the same position the pen is hovering over the board. Its much more comfortable to draw in the center of the board but if you try to, the cursor will return to the center of the screen instead of remaining in the last position, which is annoying. I got this as a starter pad since it was inexpensive, but if I could go back I would have just held out until I could buy a drawing pad with a screen.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well after an annoyance.
customer_reviews.text: Oh really easy to use beginner tablet the only annoying thing I found about it is before I could use add to download some software that there was no clear instructions on how to download. For people less literate with tech this might be hard for them at the beginning but after I downloaded the software it was really easy to use. Mainly use it to do online homework so I don’t have to waste paper. The pen also comes with a total of four nibs which is really nice which should last you a good while before you would have to buy new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Yaw Yeeet

customer_reviews.title: It works and it's great for under $100
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little tablet. I had a wacom graphire 4 Tablet for over ten years, the only trouble I've ever had with it was with the pen. So I have high hopes for this much smaller tablet. The pen is easier and softer on my hand. It's so lightweight and easy to tote around. BUT had to come back and redact a star because the pen nib already has some very pronounced wear on it after only using it for less than a week. This is saddening. But still would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy performance, easy to make irritating mistakes with it.
customer_reviews.text: The stylus to screen performance is sloppy and inaccurate. I've adjusted the settings but it just doesn't cut it. I've owned a higher-end Wacom tablet that worked much better. However the pen broke on that model and it's $80 just to replace it. I went with Wacom over the other brands thinking that by spending the extra money, it would make a difference. It appears that it didn't. This Wacom just isn't ergonomic or effective. It's easy to make irritating mistakes with it. For now it's just collecting dust now and I'm back to using a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Not made in china

customer_reviews.title: Wacom tablet
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is easy to use. My daughter had never done digital drawing and has/is still enjoying learning how to use the different features. The so called "Free" software downloads are bull, you do get to download software but have to pay a monthly fee to continue using the up to date versions of the software. That's very misleading and was saddening to my daughter. She went online and found a truly "FREE" software that she is using with her tablet and like I said she is enjoying the tablet. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: kymberlee s.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! Works well on iMac and MacBook
customer_reviews.text: My son has been inspired to draw more lately, and after searching far and wide I bought this Wacom Intuos drawing tablet so he can use with Opentoonz on his old iMac, and it works great! This combo works very smooth with no lag. Works well with my Corel painter too. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet - so glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tablet! It has completely changed my workflow, sparked creativity, and the compact size lets me take it with me anywhere! It was super easy to install and worked with my Macbook Pro almost instantly. There’s a slight learning curve if you’re a beginner that hasn’t used a graphics tablet before (like me) but once I got the hang of it, I absolutely love it and favor it over my mouse or touchpad for basic navigation even when I’m not illustrating! Great tablet at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet to learn on
customer_reviews.text: I am brand new to digital illustration. Had no idea what to get but Wacom was always the brand name I heard again and again. I am pleased to say they deliver. I don't know what they higher end tablets give you, but for the price this one really delivers and I am loving learning with it. Had no problem accessing the software download. I will say that Corel's online help is very out of date and practically useless with this version of the software. But that's not Wacom's fault and I've been finding the answers I seek easily enough. This is a good tablet. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: TQKimber

customer_reviews.title: 19 dollar option is better
customer_reviews.text: I noticed no difference in the 19 dollar option, except the 100 dollars...
customer_reviews.author: WillHenry

customer_reviews.title: Shocking Customer Service; Buggy Software
customer_reviews.text: Bought the tablet for 9-year old daughter as it was recommended by Wirecutter.com. Spent the better part of two days trying to get through to the website to register the product, and then trying (and failing) to get the bundled software downloaded and operating. Unresponsive customer service. I will give anything with the name Wacom a miss in the future. They are slow learners--From online posts they had the same problems during Christmas of 2017 and haven't fixed anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This makes photo editing soooo much easier than using a track pad or mouse.
customer_reviews.author: GlennMS

customer_reviews.title: Neither pen pressure or free software aspects seem available
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a smaller Huion. Out of the box, Huion's pen pressure worked. Not so with this Wacom, at least none of the software I use can detect differences in pen pressure, although the same software could detect with the Huion. In addition, this is SUPPOSED to come with free software like Corel Draw. Maybe, maybe not - Wacom keeps me in an infinite circular loop about needing to register to get it. So in fact, it comes with NOTHING! Feel I could have saved about 100 dollars had I simply remained with Huion Products. Update: Wacom Customer Support is non existent, so will be returning this as it does not work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: rag

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the wireless version of this tablet, and it had no trouble connecting to my MacBook. As far as the included software, I’ve only tried Clip Studio Paint up time this point, but it works great and was fairly simple to install. The stylus is easy to use, and I’m yet to notice issues of my hand interfering with anything. I do feel like the stylus will quickly be worn down by the surface of the tablet, but the stylus includes three extra nibs for replacement, and more can always be ordered. I ordered a small, and it’s incredibly lightweight. I could see it being very easy to travel with. Overall, I really liked the product!
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Still the Best
customer_reviews.text: I've always trusted Wacom. I got an open box item Wacom Bamboo years ago and it was my first experience with a drawing tablet. I was pleased to see they are still bringing the quality all of these years later. Very easy to use. Pro tip - set one of your pen clicks as CTRL+Z to easily go back an action when using PS/AI/etc. Set your right and left buttons on the tablet itself to your [ and ] bracket keys. That way you can increase and decrease your eraser/brush sizes with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Lipski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for lightroom and Photoshop
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I use it for lightroom and Photoshop for fine details. I don't really use the Bluetooth I just use a wire that comes with it. But it's nice that there's no batteries in the pen. I haven't really figured out the pressure sensitivity part for light room It's described to do. put over all I'm very pleased has increased my workflow and made things a lot easier versus using a mouse. If you're looking for some simple for light room or Photoshop this works perfect. I may upgrade to the pro at some point.
customer_reviews.author: B.m

customer_reviews.title: Pen stinks-- smells like cat urine
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this a good review, but the pen has a really strong odor that only can be described as being similar to cat urine. For those who have owned a cat, you will recognize the smell. I tried wiping the pen down with rubbing alcohol to get rid of the smell, but that didn't even put a dent in it. The odor seems to be slowly going away over time. But some spots on the pen still have a strong, pungent smell. If the smell doesn't go away quickly, I will be returning the tablet. I can't fathom any reason why the pen would smell this badly. It really stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, software has a bit of a learning curve for newbies
customer_reviews.text: I wish i could give 4.75... easy to use, software has a bit of a learning curve for newbies. There's a long written guide that you can click through, but most artists learn better by watching, so it took a long time to learn how to fill color from one layer to the next - why if you used vector for lines, you need a raster layer to do color fills. Lots of good tutorials online by various artists, but most focus on the drawings instead of how to use the software features themselves. all in all - really love working with this and the software is a great bonus!!
customer_reviews.author: Company in Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: The setup was easy, and so far we like the tablet
customer_reviews.text: The setup was easy, and so far we like the tablet. Biggest complaint right now is that when prompted to download the "free" software that is supposed to be included with the tablet after registering on the Wacom page, I get an HTTP Error 400. Don't advertise free software downloads, then make them unavailable.
customer_reviews.author: CarethAK

customer_reviews.title: No free software as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Must register device to get free software. Automatic registration doesn't work. Manual registration doesn't work. Tried to contact Tech Support - recommended that I call at 6:00 a.m. No Wacom future for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: there seems to be a slight issue with fine details and small lines
customer_reviews.text: Works Really well for what its worth, however, there seems to be a slight issue with fine details and small lines. When drawing smaller lines (less than 4mm) instead of drawing a small path, it just jumps across 4mm later and than draws normally. I do not know if the issue was just with Krita (the drawing software I was using) but it seemed to be a reoccurring issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Uwaphua

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I am a math teacher. I teach face to face as well as remotely. I cannot imagine how I would solve math problems without this tablet. I use it every single day. It has never failed to work, and it is so easy to operate. I teach large classes so I cannot afford to have a product that is undependable. This works well to display math problems as I would teach them on a whiteboard. I will continue to use it no matter what the teaching situation because I can face my students as I solve problems. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SRCurtsi

customer_reviews.title: Got started immediately
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher that needed to get started with virtual classes immediately, this tablet was extremely easy to use. Just plugged into my USB port and after the software was loaded and a few things adjusted for the pen in my Window's setting, I was ready to teach.
customer_reviews.author: pg

customer_reviews.title: I’m into creating digital art now!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! This is my first tablet and I normally do abstract, and this was one of my originally sketches from my book. I am using photoshop and for my first time I can get use this this form of drawing vice the old school way of pen and paper. Plus this helps with my clothing brand when it comes to converting my images over for t-shirt designs. I definitely would recommend this for any just starting into the digital world. Ease of use and very light. Will definitely look into a higher model with a screen after some time of bettering better on my first tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: It's Wacom
customer_reviews.text: I have used wacom for years. I don't have a problem with the product, but I tried to register it, in fact, thought I had registered it, only to find that I couldn't log on to my account. Several weeks later tried again. This time it worked. I really just wanted to see the software they included as a free incentive to purchase, so having to go through all that trouble to check it out was ridiculous. I haven't ever used their tech support, but I can't imagine that it would be effective.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: New to tablets, like this one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the suggestion of a friend because I mentioned I wanted to learn "real" photoshop instead of Elements. Takes some adjusting to but so far I like it, it does make cropping photos very fast. The table was easy to set up, I watched some videos about peoples setup preferences, like making one of the buttons on the pen be the "undo" command and changing the mapping on the table to be a smaller area so you don't have to move the pen all over. So far I like it and I am looking forward to mastering it as I learn to edit photos really well with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Tablet and three good quality software tools to go with it. The tablet is very affordable and the software is worth as much. Pleased with the new stylus, intuitive (see image).
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Saved my online statistics class
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet with the idea of using it in my introductory statistics class. I usually need to solve problems by hand using a whiteboard during class, but my students sometimes do not copy the solutions accurately. Also, my classes are also long and I get tired of using the whiteboard. This tool solve those problems because I don't have to move, and I can save my solutions into a file and share it after class. Now when covid-19 hit, my classes switched online, without this tool my classes would have been boring ...because I could not have solve the problems by hand....this great gadget saved my online teaching experience. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos F. Pavon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get the Bluetooth one. Stick with an old school version.
customer_reviews.text: I do like Wacom tablets but I regret buying the Bluetooth one. It doesn’t hold the batter long, and I work at my computer every day, around the middle of a work day I have to put it to charge. When you’re on 20% you have about 5 min of work time, which is Absolutley inconvenient. :( it is also wearing out faster than the older one. I had my previous one for several years and it still looks like new (just doesn’t work anymore). This one I’ve used for only a few months and the touch part looks really worn out :/
customer_reviews.author: Daria

customer_reviews.title: In love with this tablet !
customer_reviews.text: The small is perfect size for me -- less distance to travel when moving from one corner of monitor to another. Can't imagine needing anything bigger. The pen works flawlessly and the driver was easy to install. And the bonus softwares are awesome ! So you get Corel Painter essentials (which does pretty much everything I need, a drawing software and a photo editing software. Purchased alone you'd be over $100. So I feel I got a great deal on this tablet. The downloadable softwares just puts it at the top of the list for me - plus this brand has been around a long time. Was a great choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Texas

customer_reviews.title: No Experience? No Problem!
customer_reviews.text: As a professional photographer I was finding it difficult to efficiently use a mouse for all my editing in Photoshop and Lightroom. So I went our on a wing and decided to give this product a try. Was a little worried at first because I have never used this type of technology and didn't know how bad the learning curve was going to be. Right out of the gate I found it was incredibly easy to use and very ergonomic. I have cut my post production time in half due to the pressure sensitive tip I found I spent less time having to change my brush size and more time editing. Thank you Wacom for making this incredible product!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Item description is misleading
customer_reviews.text: The item description said it has 3 free additional software bundle that can be downloaded, but when i registered the product, i can only install 1 and even the box says that i can only choose 1 out of the 2 free product software. The item description is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund C.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product, daughter loves it, do NOT get it wet!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this tablet and spends hours a day drawing with it. But last week a clogged toilet (thanks, kids) + a leaky fill valve resulted in the toilet overflowing overnight and leaking water down from the 2nd floor into the first floor through the ceiling fan -- raining water down onto the iMac, the keyboard, the mouse, and splashing onto the Wacom tablet which was only 2 months old. We dried off everything, and everything still worked EXCEPT the Wacom tablet. No sympathy from Amazon or Wacom, just had to buy a new one. It wasn't even that wet... For a device that looks and could easily be waterproof, it is really not. That was annoying all around.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works on Linux/Android/Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and no drivers needed for Linux but drivers are available for advanced features. Battery-less pen is great and has 3 spare tips inside. Very accurate and excellent for any uiser. Just takes a few minutes getting used to if you are using it as a mouse replacement although can be used in parallel with a mouse. Can be used with included USB cable or bluetooth. Also works great for android/chromebooks making e-signing with real signature possible as well as white-boarding, drawing,etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M Olcese

customer_reviews.title: Can't even figure out if it works
customer_reviews.text: I tried to download the software twice. Failed both times after following directions on the site. No problem, my husband is an engineer with two Master's Degrees. He eventually gave up and walked out (not on me, on the product). I suppose I could have pursued this further by speaking with the company, but whoever built their site doesn't speak anything I speak. You shouldn't have to know how something works in order to get it to work. It was a good idea, sadly inoperable. And why are all the reviews from 2018, mmmmmmm?
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a drawing tablet before, so I thought I'd go with something for beginners. I'm very happy with my purchase! I'm a traditionally trained artist, so getting used to drawing with the tablet was a slight adjustment, but after an hour or two of fiddling around, I got pretty comfortable with it. This tablet was super easy to set up. Like, crazy easy. And I like how easy it is to use. Again, it's crazy easy after the initial adjustment. Plus, It has a nice range of sensitivity. If you're a beginner or just getting started with digital art, this is a great way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: Delighted I Bought It
customer_reviews.text: My whole experience with the seller and the manufacturer of the tablet was excellent. The seller delivered me what I wanted in a very timely fashion. I did have a couple of problems with the accompanying software packages, but Wacom was truly fantastic. Their customer service was phenomenal. I spoke with a representative once and he was everything we hope for in a representative. Their CS department followed through until all issues were resolved. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Buff

customer_reviews.title: Came With An Already EXPIRED Software Key!
customer_reviews.text: Rating at a 1 star as I need to resolve an issue with the 2 year software key that is ALREADY EXPIRED! I bought this from Amazon earlier this month (December 2019) to gift as a Christmas present to my son. I did check it thoroughly to make sure it wasn’t a typo on my end. Though my son was able to use the tablet to draw, we were unable to save anything because we were not able to register with the already expired license number that came with the Wacom Tablet. It is useless without the license!
customer_reviews.author: Sundae

customer_reviews.title: No touch support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one over a cheapo generic tablet specifically because I wanted gesture and touch support. As of 2018, they have removed these features from all non-pro models, a detail which was not obvious. I am returning the product; I do not support companies which remove basic functionality to make their more expensive SKUs more attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Teacher Recommended for online use!
customer_reviews.text: I teach middle school math currently online like most of the U.S. Modeling is so crucial when teaching math, I was able to set up and start using right away. Each time I used it my writing improved and was VERY EASY to use! I would recommend this to anyone who teaches online!
customer_reviews.author: Irene T. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great for Zoom meetings
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my Zoom whiteboard. It takes a little adjusting at first. But this is a great drawing tablet. It's easy to install and learn. It is also pretty reasonably priced. The brand is one of the best in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: 15 years old daughter loves it. It was easy for her to install on her window 10 laptop. Only complains is that the amazon driver throw the tablet at the door didn't even ring the bell and when i open the door about 9 pm it was there and it was raining. luckily nothing happened to the tablet. ... but that has nothing to do with how good the tablet is. Thanks 😊👍
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Rsado

customer_reviews.title: installation is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The installation software didn't work; 2 different techs told me different things. One confirmed that the software that the 'desktop center' software that Wacom installed was wrong and it wouldn't update. Then said I needed to to into the guts of windows to uninstall and install manually. Forget it... if the tablet is anywhere near as bad as their software it's not worth it. It's going back. Update: and now their driver won't uninstall so pieces of it are still on my laptop. Really? in 2020? Very frustrated, I really wanted this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Pegleg

customer_reviews.title: Drivers are the downfall
customer_reviews.text: So many reviews complained about the drivers. I thought, "but that won't happen to me." But it did. It's why I never got this to work and why I returned it. Long story: I had a Wacom tablet in 2005. I've migrated systems several times since then. That old driver software apparently still partially remained on my computer and a driver written in 2019 could not install because of that slight sniff of old software which I could not (despite over an hour of frustrating combing) locate and eradicate.
customer_reviews.author: Sica Corey

customer_reviews.title: Didn't include Painter Essentials 7 (10-19-19)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because reviews were good for beginners and because it came with the software. Was a little rough getting it set up but finally got it working. Also was excited it was coming with the new Painter Essentials 7 (as advertised) but could only get Painter Essentials 6 was an option, very disappointing. Will take some time to figure everything out but once I work through I will add to this review.
customer_reviews.author: Anna  Young

customer_reviews.title: Not totally free software but it's a nice device
customer_reviews.text: All good so far. Win10 completely supports it as an inking device. Anime app seems very complete. Not a basic product, but you only get a two year subscription. It's not totally free software. Couldn't get the pressure effect to work with the software but I guess there's a setting someplace. I'll update this review when I find it.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Use With Photoshop
customer_reviews.text: I love my Intuou Drawing tablet. This is my second one. The first one lasted for more than eight years before deciding to stop working. I have the medium size tablet and I love it. Anything larger would be too big for my workspace and anything smaller would be difficult to work with. I do a lot of work in Photoshop and rely on my intuos pad for that work. It’s very easy to clean. You just wipe it off. It’s very easy to install. You just plug it in. For the money, this is a great helper.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Worst install ever
customer_reviews.text: I've used Wacom tablets since the 1990s, I'm not a newb. I bought this model recently to have a newer model that I can take with me and is wireless. Installing it on my MacBook Pro was the worst experience I've had in years with a software/hardware product. The device itself is nice enough, but the install... ugh... it's still a nightmare in my mind a week later. It took at least 3 reboots. Remember, this was not on Windows, where my expectation for the necessity of reboots is different. This was on a Mac, you know, art folks Wacom's market. I hope they turn their act around because I've liked Wacom products in the past.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad info tracking
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has been a lot of fun for me to get into digital artwork. It was easy to use and the software it came with is a great starting point. It loses a star on tracking every app or program you open it with. I read through the disclosures and privacy settings and it was not clear that they would be tracking specific programs outside of their own offerings.
customer_reviews.author: K F

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is one of the best I’ve used, it is compact, lightweight, and Bluetooth enabled. But the fact that you can still use it while it is charging makes it worth it right there. I don’t have to waste time waiting for my pencil to charge (if you know what I mean). Art software is also fantastic. My son drew this drawing with it. It has a super sleek design and is perfect for the price. Overall: Nice for working on the go where size and weight matter.
customer_reviews.author: siva.k.vittala

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I had been using an iPad+Apple Pencil for drawing and image editing and while those programs are still great, it was a pain to not be able to edit PhotoShop files directly with a stylus. The Intuos is easy to use and reliable. It's perfect! The only hiccup has more to do with Apple than Wacom. If you're using an Apple computer the bluetooth connection is SUPER laggy if you are using a Magic Mouse or wireless keyboard. For my Macbook Pro I just turn those off and use the built-in keyboard and touch pad instead. With my iMac I use the included USB cable and everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C.

customer_reviews.title: No free software!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my son for Christmas. I spent all Christmas eve trying to download the "free" software. NOPE, NOT FREE! I still had to spend $50 for software. No codes came with the box when you download the software from the website. Part of the reason I bought this tablet was the free software. He's 13 and I didn't want to invest a lot of money for him to try it out. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this tablet. The pen skips and misses parts when you're coloring. The 'pressure' pen is horrible. I've gotten tablets for forty dollars that work better than this. I've tried literally everything... adjusting settings, redownloading drivers, updating my art programs and even restarting my computer to see if that was the issue. Nothing has worked. It's just going to sit here and collect dust now because the return policy on amazon is ridiculous. Please don't buy this tablet, even for beginners, it's bad. Don't waste your money. Even the 'extra art programs' on it aren't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: walosigoddess

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Xmas 2018. She wanted a drawing tablet but had never used one before. After researching and reading lots of reviews (both here and on various websites), I decided this would be the best option for her. She has used it consistently since I purchased it and it still works just as well as the first day. It didn't take long for her to learn how to use it (like maybe 20 mins) and the included software seems to be good for what she wanted. I'm sure one day she'll want an upgraded version but for now, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Hess

customer_reviews.title: Great but definitely go bigger!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: - great for first timer users of drawing tablets - comes with software which definitely encouraged my purchase - easy to use pen and tools - simple setup and tablet design - loving wireless/bluetooth Dislikes: - would purchase a bigger tablet size (got the smallest and I knew immediately I should of went bigger) - bluetooth took a while to setup with my laptop so had to reconfigure several times but since successful connection no problems reconnecting since (all I gotta do is turn on and it’s good to go) - no additional nibs/replacement nibs All in all great buy but will definitely get a larger tablet size next time.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for Autodesk Mudbox and it works with ease. Everything is great including the build quality, precision and software. The only thing is that for beginners, it is hard to get used to but with practice it becomes like second nature. The one thing that I do not like is the pen tip. I think that including a ball point roller instead of a stationary plastic tip would be more beneficial. The reason for this is that after intense use or pressing down, the friction causes the tip to degrade over time, causing me to replace it. A minor issue but would be more convenient if the tip were never replaced if it rolled.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Took out my audio
customer_reviews.text: It interferes with my computer audio on my Alienware. Took it out. I had to reload my original audio on dell alienware. Unplugged this and it sits unused on my desk. Spent hours trying to solve the problem. Still haven’t solved it. I googled the problem and Apparently the problem exists for other computers too as it interferes with audio drivers. Would really like to give it a chance so I have to call the company to ask for help. I will change my review,if,I receive assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter tablet, Software included = Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tablet about 5 weeks ago, and IT'S PERFECT! I use Clip Studio Art (which is included). CSA has amazing tech support on their website. The tablet itself is a great value: extra nibs included, pen doesn't not need to be charged/battery-changed. Battery life lasts a whole drawing session for me (which could be ~1-4 hours).
customer_reviews.author: Loretta McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first pen tablet. This product is amazing . Pro quality I think. I love it so much . It is easy , I had trouble with installing and I also have trouble with software but it could be because of my computer... But it worths it. I would recommend to get a case for this tablet because there is no pen holder ... I keep losing the pen .
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Useless junk
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now and still am unable to use it for anything other than a mouse substitute. As _many_ other users have said the Wacom website is useless. It is non-functional. As difficult as this is to believe; a modern multi-billion dollar company can't launch a working website, it's true. The '3 Bonus Software' they claim is included is not available. Sure, the website has lots of pretty pictures of the apparently amazing things you can do with this pad and with their software but that software may as well not exist b/c I and many others simply cannot download it.
customer_reviews.author: matt okeefe

customer_reviews.title: Wacom product support, turorials, and set up suck!
customer_reviews.text: Never mind the difficulty with registration, can not be done with a wizard, has to be done with a phone call, the tutorials at impossible to access for basic use and customer support consists of a chat line, never available, and a phone line. CAN"T rate the product as I CANNOT access a proper tutorial. VERY UNHAPPY. Apparently Wacom main frame computer issues resolved. We'll see. Still difficult.
customer_reviews.author: RandomWayne

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact, efficient little tool
customer_reviews.text: This item was bought for my adult daughter. She was so happy when it came much sooner the it was expected. She got on it right away. She said there are tons of tools available within the program, and that even though there is definitely a learning curve, it is user friendly. It is a beginner’s version, with tons, and tons of brushes, shadows, colors, screens, etc so I can only imagine what she can create with.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H.

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Wacom’s intuos series is designed as an affordable entry-level tablet, perfect for beginners looking for a reliable creative pen tablet that will last for years. It includes three free editing software, which makes it an exceptional value. Unlike Wacom’s flashier Cintiq line of creative pen displays, the Intuos series isn’t itself a screen. Moving the pen over the tablet is somewhat similar to moving your finger on a trackpad or using a mouse — the movement is in your hands, but your eyes remain forward, looking at the monitor. While it sounds less instinctive than drawing directly on the screen, with practice it‘ll feel natural.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: You’ll probably want to buy refill nibs for the pencil if you are going to use it frequently
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a class and to try out digital drawing. It is very light and portable and the box it comes in is very sturdy (don’t throw it away it’s good for storage)! The only thing is the pencil nibs run down very fast - if you are going to use it frequently you’ll need to get replacement nibs.
customer_reviews.author: CM
